intro: Sidneya tenuifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf sidneya, is a perennial herb native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic, often hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a distinctive silvery-white underside that gives it a striking appearance. Sidneya tenuifolia thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
